clinical_study.brief_title: Supine Versus Left Lateral Tilted Position During Cesarean Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: Hemodynamic Effects of Supine Position Versus Left Lateral Tilted Position During Cesarean Delivery: a Randomized Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, we will investigate the effect of left lateral tiling performed after spinal block on maternal hemodynamics compared to ordinary supine position

detailed_description.textblock: Maternal hypotension is a common complication after spinal anesthesia for cesarean delivery (CD). Aortocaval compression is one of the theoretical mechanisms precipitating for post-spinal hypotension (PSH) for CD. Positioning of the patients in the left lateral tilted position after preforming spinal block was frequently considered a standard protocol for minimizing aortocaval compression and improve maternal hemodynamics during CD; however, the latest Cochrane database review reported that there is no adequate evidence to support any positioning protocol for prevention of PSH. Moreover, a recent study was conducted in full term pregnant women reporting no improvement in cardiac output with left lateral tilting. In this study, the effect of left lateral tiling performed after spinal block on maternal hemodynamics will be compared to ordinary supine position.

primary_outcome.description: The number of patients who develop hypotension (defined as decreased SBP less than 80% of the baseline reading during the period from intrathecal injection till delivery of the fetus) after spinal block divided by the total number in the group

secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients who develop hypotension (defined as decreased SBP less than 60% of the baseline reading during the period from intrathecal injection till delivery of the fetus) after spinal block divided by the total number in the group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- full term
- singleton pregnant women
- scheduled for elective cesarean delivery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiac morbidities
- hypertensive disorders of pregnancy
- peripartum bleeding
- baseline systolic blood pressure (SBP) < 100 mmHg
- body mass index > 35
